poem:
Title: Upon a Dawn-like Dusk

Moonlight's silver threads sew silence,
on the quilt of a carless street. 
A singular kite, a pyre in twilight,
tweaks its tail, dances to heartbeats.
High as rook, crow, gull soar,
invisible whispers cleanse the cosmic floor. 
Beneath heaven's dome, our breath reborn -
A hush heralds the dawn of an ozone morn.
